sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些程度副词都有"相当，颇"之意。
means: fairly ： 语意最弱，多用于褒义，表示适度地、尚可的意思。不可与too或比较级连用。
pretty ： 用法与rather相似。常用于非正式文体。
quite含义比fairly稍强，与不定冠词连用时，一般放在不定冠词之前。
rather语气比quite强，褒意贬意无可使用。可与too和比较级连用。

means.word_mean: 完全地; 整体地; 十分地

sentences.en: Are you quite ready?
sentences.cn: 你完全准备好了吗?

sentences.en: The news is quite amazing.
sentences.cn: 这消息十分惊人。

sentences.en: I quite like some rock music.
sentences.cn: 我很喜欢某些摇滚乐。

means.word_mean: 有几分; 颇; 相当

sentences.en: It was quite good, but not perfect.
sentences.cn: 它相当不错, 但还不完善。

sentences.en: He is a quite skilled worker.
sentences.cn: 他是个相当熟练的工人。

sentences.en: Our meeting in London was quite by chance.
sentences.cn: 我们在伦敦的会面颇为偶然。

means.word_mean: 〈尤英〉同意, 不错; 对的

sentences.en: He is quite drunk.
sentences.cn: 他确实喝醉了。

data.mean: quite some sth 大量；众多
quite a lot (of sth) 大量；许多；众多

sentence.en: Well,  I've been to quite some countries,  but not yet to Norway.

lj.lj_ly: she hasn't quite got the hang of it yet.

jx.jx_en_mean: used to indicate that the specified person or thing is perceived as particularly notable, remarkable, or impressive
jx.jx_cn_mean: 异常的；出众的；印象很深的

lj.lj_ly: quite the little horsewoman, aren't you?.
lj.lj_ls: 你真是个出色的小女骑手，对吧？。

lj.lj_ly: quite the little horsewoman, aren't you?.
lj.lj_ls: 你真是个出色的小女骑手，对吧？。

jx.jx_en_mean: a considerable number or amount of something

lj.lj_ly: my job involves quite a lot of travel.
lj.lj_ls: 我的工作需要经常旅行。

lj.lj_ly: he's quite a bit older than she is.
she hasn't been seen for quite some time.
lj.lj_ls: 人们很长时间没见到她了。

jx.jx_en_mean: informal way of saying quite a

lj.lj_ly: I'm afraid Oliver isn't feeling quite the thing this morning.
lj.lj_ls: 恐怕奥利弗今早感觉不舒服。

entry.def: You use quite to indicate that something is the case to a fairly great extent. Quite is less emphatic than 'very' and 'extremely'.

example.ex: I felt quite bitter about it at the time...
example.tran: 当时我对这件事感到相当怨愤。

example.ex: I was doing quite well, but I wasn't earning a lot of money...
example.tran: 我干得还算不错，可是挣的钱却不算多。

entry.def: You use quite to emphasize what you are saying.

example.ex: It is quite clear that we were firing in self defence...
example.tran: 事实很清楚，我们开枪是出于自卫。

example.ex: That's a general British failing. In the USA it's quite different...
example.tran: 那是英国人的普遍缺点。在美国，情况就大不一样了。

entry.def: You use quite after a negative to make what you are saying weaker or less definite.
entry.tran: (与否定词连用，表示语气较弱或不确定)

example.ex: Something here is not quite right...
example.tran: 这里有什么地方不太对劲。

example.ex: After treatment he was able to continue but he was never quite the same...
example.tran: 治疗之后他又可以继续下去了，可是再也恢复不到从前的状态了。

entry.def: You use quite in front of a noun group to emphasize that a person or thing is very impressive or unusual.
entry.tran: （用于名词词组前，表示强调）出众的，了不起的，不同寻常的

example.ex: 'Oh, he's quite a character,' Sean replied...
example.tran: “喔，他真是个了不起的人，”肖恩回答说。
波士顿，真是一座伟大的城市。

entry.def: You can say 'quite' to express your agreement with someone.

example.ex: 'And if you buy the record it's your choice isn't it.' — 'Quite'...
example.tran: “如果你买这张唱片，那是你的选择，不是吗？”——“可不是嘛。”

example.ex: 'I won't say over the air who it is.' — 'No, quite.'
example.tran: “我不会在电话里说出那个人是谁。”——“对，的确应该这样。”

means.word_mean: 1. to a degree (not used with a negative);
3. of an unusually noticeable or exceptional or remarkable kind (not used with a negative);
4. actually or truly or to an extreme;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from the obsolete adjective quite, variant of quit
